imdb.title: Denpa Kyoushi
imdb.plot: Junichiro Kagami, a prodigy in physics to an ultimate otaku, is forced to work as a teacher. Many adventures follow as he helps each of his students with their personal problems as well as his own.

episodes.title: Koukou kyoushi hajimemashita
episodes.plot: Kagami's sister ends his NEET lifestyle, forcing him to get a job. He joins the staff at his old high school, and meets a student with an ambitious dream.

episodes.title: Shakai no ruuru
episodes.plot: After surviving for a month as a teacher, Junichiro decides to celebrate with a trip to Akihabara with his sister. But it turns out that even in his otaku paradise, he can't fully escape school life.

episodes.title: Cheisu de Akihabara
episodes.plot: A mysterious young woman offers to recruit Junichiro Kagami as a teacher at her school. Junichiro, unwilling to let go of his freedom, escapes to his natural Otaku habitat, the town of Akihabara. The chase is on!

episodes.title: Meido no hinkaku
episodes.plot: For Junichiro's first lecture, he attempts to change the views of stubborn Makina Momozono, Koyomi's right-hand girl. What does it mean to have dignity as a maid in an Akihabara-style Maid Cafe?

episodes.title: Gin'nan gakuen no kaibutsu
episodes.plot: Kagami encounters his first unruly student at Ichou Academy, Nanami Seijuurou. Will he survive when the chairwoman orders them to face off in three days?

episodes.title: An Amusing View
episodes.plot: Kagami plans to make Seijuurou face him in a real game of soccer! It seems hopeless, until Seijuurou remembers a soccer video game trick.

episodes.title: A Beautiful Girl's Secret
episodes.plot: Chinami Kanan hasn't spoken aloud to anyone since middle school! Can Kagami get her to open up-and hear her amazing real-life anime voice?

episodes.title: The Truant is a Grand Master
episodes.plot: Who needs school if you have a career? Who needs friends when you have thousands of loyal fans? Sachiko Tanaka is too busy for school, and Junichiro would normally agree. Will he find a way to get her to come to school? Will he even try?

episodes.title: The Girl in the Game
episodes.plot: Kagami needs 35 people to complete the final event quest in the MMO Uroboros! He recruits his class to help, but he's short one person...

episodes.title: The Melancholy of Koutaro
episodes.plot: Koutaro Araki, the class truant also known as Luce, teaches his classmates how to play Uroboros. The team rapidly becomes competition-ready. However, will Koutaro be able to face his fears and stand side by side with his classmates?

episodes.title: The Outside World
episodes.plot: One by one, Koutarou slowly meets his classmates. Meanwhile, Kagami begins making mysterious plans...

episodes.title: Luce vs. The First
episodes.plot: Koutarou attends the Victory Party, but faces a terrible challenge from Kagami! Can he prevail while the surprise guests look on?

episodes.title: The Doctor from Geneva
episodes.plot: Tim, a scientist of international fame, bursts into the Kagami household, offering Junichiro a job offer that few others would turn down. Junichiro refuses the offer, but cannot back down from Tim's intellectual challenge.

episodes.title: The Assessment Girl
episodes.plot: Madoka Kuramochi has a super power - she can see the yen value of anything, including people. What price does she put on Junichiro? Obviously not a trivial amount, since she now wants to marry him!

episodes.title: The FiancÃ© is a Game King
episodes.plot: Hell Gates, Madoka's fiancÃ©, is a CEO, genius programmer, and undisputed video game champion. In order to thwart the plan to force the marriage, Junichiro fights Gates on his own turf - but not without his usual assortment of tricks.

episodes.title: Take Me to the Afterlife
episodes.plot: Koyomi talks Junichiro into cleaning up the school boarding house, which had been closed off for a year. When its current inhabitant introduces herself, Junichiro is presented with the unique opportunity of working his magic on a dead student.

episodes.title: Turmoil on Day One
episodes.plot: Truant Koutaro Araki finally gathers the courage to come to school, and instantly becomes popular. His classmates try to help make his transition as smooth as possible, but Kanan and Makina get involved in a slightly different way.

episodes.title: A Gamer's Pride
episodes.plot: Makina's brother Kazuya can't seem to find his way out of his losing streak in a trading card game. Joe Odawara is in love, but won't be able to confess his feelings without help. Junichiro has answers for both of them... Maybe.

episodes.title: Street Gangs
episodes.plot: Junichiro meets Taki, a girl who loves her home town, and loves hanging out with her friends. Her sister, however, asks Junichiro to help Taki find a better life.

episodes.title: The Twin Idol
episodes.plot: Nagare, Taki's sister, is a professional idol singer, but is apparently willing to sacrifice her career if that's what it takes to make her sister Taki quit her street gang. It's up to Junichiro to hear her out and find a solution.

episodes.title: Here come the Family Rangers!
episodes.plot: Nagare is kidnapped! With her career as a pop star in peril, Taki and Junichiro decide to solve the matter with their own hands - and in Junichiro's particular style.

episodes.title: Castle Junichiro
episodes.plot: Junichiro's most troubled students have all found new, better lives - but at what cost? Junichiro realizes just how much of his old life he is sacrificing to help the kids. At the same time, a part of his old life pays a visit.

episodes.title: The Job Try Out Girl
episodes.plot: Junichiro accepts the invitation to the KEC research team. However, something inside him is not truly convinced that this is truly what he yearns to do. One day, a mysterious girl joins the lab as a one-day try-out intern.

episodes.title: My Educational Policies
episodes.plot: It's time for Reiko to leave the KEC, but she doesn't want to. She fiercely refuses to obey, and her refusal provides Junichiro with the final piece of the puzzle to complete his educational policies.
